DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Report Negation NCI Metathesaurus Code java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A pathology report provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. Report defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread. Essential information to be included in a pathology report: the date and name of the report, slide number, the source of the specimen, the primary tumor size, he histologic diagnosis including the grade or degree of differentiation, the extent of disease within and beyond the primary site._Negation is an operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Metathesaurus._Value Domain for java language String datatype.
